name: Best Com. RTU, Env., PC (EE+DF)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical penetration is captured in the baseline

energy_efficiency_source: Determined by custom savings shape information in 'tsv_features'

installed_cost_source.notes: Total installed cost for high efficiency RTU in 2017 divided by typical output capacity (90 kBtu/h); assumes no additional costs for load shifting capabilities; restrict to small commercial RTUs; incremental envelope package cost of is added (see https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1g09M5XISuHJus555G2J10bXpwprEyMMaJ1Imer9OnTQ/edit?usp=sharing)

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetimes for high efficiency RTU in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.title: CBECS 2012 - Table B29 - Primary space-heating energy sources, floorspace
market_scaling_fractions_source.fraction_derivation: Ventilation fraction is portion of ventilation in commercial buildings that use RTUs for cooling (45,153 sf/79,294 sf).

_description: Adjust heating/cooling set point down/up to shed peak period electricity use, pair with passive thermal energy storage and envelope/HVAC equipment efficiency generally corresponding to AEDG 50% guideline across building types; restrict to RTUs
_notes: Measure Definition and Status Google spreadsheet contains calculations for combining RTU and commercial envelope measures and converting units
